So how does that explain that when I set json:"-" I get the required format?

On Fri, Apr 15, 2016, 04:42 kostya-sh <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> This works according to the spec.
>
> As @rogpeppe <https://github.com/rogpeppe> mentioned, in your first
> example MarshalJSON method is promoted to base from Mes and is used to
> encode an instance of base type.
>
> In your second example (with Mes1 type) MarshalJSON is not promoted.
> Relevant parts of Go spec:
>
> A field or method f of an anonymous field in a struct x is called promoted
> if x.f is a legal *selector* that denotes that field or method f.
>
> and
>
> The following rules apply to selectors:
>
>    1. For a value x of type T or *T where T is not a pointer or interface
>    type, x.f denotes the field or method at the shallowest depth in T where
>    there is such an f. *If there is not exactly one f with shallowest
>    depth, the selector expression is illegal.*
>
